ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you stopped others from using negative LGBTQ+ words (e.g., that's so gay, fag, dyke, he/she, tranny)?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you welcomed your teen's LGBTQ+ friends to your home, family events, or activities?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you said say supportive things about your teen's sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you stood up for your teen when they've been mistreated because of their sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you encouraged others to be respectful of your teen's sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you knowingly taken your teen/did *NAME* knowingly take you to an LGBTQ+ youth organization or event?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Thinking of the teen completing the program with you. In the past month, how welcoming have you been to your teen's LGBTQ+ dating partner(s)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little bit; 2= Somewhat; 3= Quite a bit; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: Have you said or implied that your teen's sexual orientation or gender identity was ''just a phase?''
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you implied that your teen should not tell others about their sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you asked your teen to dress or act more masculine or more feminine because of their sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you said or implied your teen was being overly sensitive for thinking they were being treated poorly because of their sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you called your teen mean names like ''fag,'' ''he/she,'' ''tranny,'' or ''dyke''?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you made offensive comments about your teen's sexual orientation or gender identity without realizing you were being offensive?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you acted as if your teen is straight or identifies with their assigned birth sex even after they told you about their sexual orientation or gender identity?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time

ElementDescription: Have you changed the topic of conversation when their sexual orientation or gender identity comes up?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Occasionally; 3= Frequently; 4= All the time
